definition: lit. to drop a thousand zhang in one fall (idiom)/fig. (of business, popularity etc) to suffer a sudden, devastating decline/to take a dive
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind
see 鞦韆|秋千[qiu1 qian1]
thousand
measure of length, ten Chinese feet (3.3 m)/to measure/husband/polite appellation for an older male

sentences.english: The acting career plummeted suddenly, he relied on alcohol to release.
sentences.chinese: 演艺事业突然一落千丈，他便借酒浇愁。

sentences.english: Other times though, things take a nosedive.
sentences.chinese: 然而其他时候，事情却会一落千丈。

sentences.english: But in common people's mind, the Jiangchuan public security's image is suffers a disastrous decline.
sentences.chinese: 而在老百姓的心目中，江川公安的形象更是一落千丈。

sentences.english: Fourth, once the incentive program ends, grades will fall in all subjects.
sentences.chinese: 第四，一旦物质刺激结束，各科成绩将会一落千丈。

sentences.english: His show biz suddenly drop, so he abreact depend on alcohol.
sentences.chinese: 演艺事业突然一落千丈，他便借酒浇愁。
继而乌克兰的经济一落千丈。

sentences.english: This system of marriage and concubinage made women experience a disastrous decline in terms of their social position.
sentences.chinese: 周代这种异姓嫡媵婚制，使周代女性地位一落千丈。

sentences.english: Your group business fell off sharply after the bubble burst.
sentences.chinese: 在泡沫破灭之后，贵公司的集团业务一落千丈。

sentences.english: Teaching Unions have beenthe final nail in the coffin and educational standards have fallen like astone.
sentences.chinese: 教师工会给出了致死一击，现在的教育标准一落千丈。

sentences.english: The prices of corporate bonds and commercial property have plunged.
sentences.chinese: 公司债券和商业地产的价格一落千丈。

sentences.english: Until the Japanese surrender in 1945, counterfeit currency plummeted.
sentences.chinese: 延至1945年日寇投降，伪钞币值一落千丈。

sentences.english: If this happens, the value of the semi-precious stones plummets .
sentences.chinese: 如果发生这种情形，半宝石的价值就一落千丈。

definition: one stumble, unable to rise (idiom); a setback leading to total collapse/ruined at a stroke/unable to recover after a minor hitch
to steadily deteriorate
to hit rock bottom (idiom)
rivers pour away by the day (idiom); going from bad to worse/deteriorating day by day
to be thoroughly discredited/to fall into disrepute
lit. like the sun at noon (idiom)/fig. to be at the peak of one's power, career etc
to develop rapidly after abrupt turn (idiom); dramatic change
Waterloo (Belgium)/Battle of Waterloo (1815)/fig. a defeat/failure
to go downhill/to decline/to slump
lit. target of a multitude of arrows (idiom); the butt of public criticism/attacked on all sides
discouraged/downhearted
to add hail to snow (idiom); one disaster on top of another/to make things worse in a bad situation
lacking in vitality/depressed (market, spirits etc)
to make progress only with great difficulty (idiom)
to vanish without trace (idiom)/to lie low
to fall/to drop
